ABNORMAL.Definition: different from what is usual or average, especially in a way that is bad

ANALOGY.Definition: a comparison between things that have similar features, often used to help explain a principle or idea

ARCHAIC.Definition: of or belonging to an ancient period in history, very old

ARSENAL.Definition: a building where weapons and military equipment are stored

CHORE.Definition: a job or piece of work that is often boring or unpleasant but needs to be done regularly

CLARIFY.Definition: to make something clear or easier to understand by giving more details or a simpler explanation

COMPOUNDS.Definition: if something compounds, the benefits increase over time

CONJUGATIONS.Definition: a group of verbs that conjugate in the same way

CORRELATION.Definition: a connection or relationship between two or more facts, numbers, etc.

DEMOTIVATING.Definition: making someone less enthusiastic about a job or task

DISRUPTIVE.Definition: causing trouble and therefore stopping something from continuing as usual

DRIFT OVER.Definition: to pass over without being properly absorbed or processed

EXPOSURE.Definition: the fact of experiencing something or being affected by it because of being in a particular situation or place

EXTENSION.Definition: the act of adding to something in order to make it bigger or longer

FAR REACHING.Definition: something far-reaching has a great influence on many people or things

FOR STARTERS.Definition: used to say that something is the first in a list of things

FOUNDATIONS.Definition: the structures below the surface of the ground that support a building

FROM SCRATCH.Definition: from the beginning, without using anything that already exists

HACKS.Definition: a shortcut, a good solution or piece of advice

MEMORISING.Definition: to learn something so that you will remember it exactly

MYRIAD.Definition: a very large number of something

MYTH.Definition: a commonly believed but false idea

MYTHS.Definition: a commonly believed but false idea

NEUROSURGEON.Definition: a doctor who performs operations involving the brain or nerves

ONGOING.Definition: continuing to exist or develop, or happening at the present moment

OPTIMISTIC.Definition: the quality of being full of hope and emphasizing the good parts of a situation, or a belief that something good will happen

PANDEMIC.Definition: (of a disease) existing in almost all of an area or in almost all of a group of people, animals, or plants

PANORAMA.Definition: a view of a wide area

PEDDLING.Definition: to sell things, especially by taking them to different places

PERSPECTIVE.Definition: a particular way of considering something

PILE.Definition: objects positioned one on top of another

POINTLESS.Definition: something that is pointless has no purpose, and it is a waste of time doing it

PREFACE.Definition: if you preface your words or actions with something else, you say or do this other thing first

PREFIXES.Definition: a letter or group of letters added to the beginning of a word to make a new word

RATIO.Definition: the relationship between two groups or amounts that expresses how much bigger one is than the other

REJOICE.Definition: to feel or show great happiness about something

RIDICULOUSLY.Definition: in a way that is stupid or unreasonable and deserves to be laughed at

SCRABBLE.Definition: a brand name for a game played on a board covered in squares in which players win points by creating words from letters with different values and connecting these words with ones already on the board

SEESAW.Definition: a long board that children play on. The board is balanced on a central point so that when a child sits on each end they can make the board go up and down by pushing off the ground with their feet .

SOLIDIFY.Definition: to become or make something become certain

SUFFIXES.Definition: a letter or group of letters added at the end of a word to make a new word

SWING.Definition: a seat joined by two ropes or chains to a metal bar or a tree, on which you can sit and move backwards and forwards

TEND TO.Definition: to be likely to behave in a particular way or have a particular characteristic

TRICKY.Definition: if a piece of work or problem is tricky, it is difficult to deal with and needs careful attention or skill

VARY.Definition: if things of the same type vary, they are different from each other, and if you vary them, you cause them to be different from each other
